name: Park Inn Hotel & Conference Center London Heathrow

reviews.text: Its close to Heathrow airport. Bus stop is just outside the hotel.Very good,clean hotel. Room size is pretty good considering the European standard! Lavish breakfast was served daily.It has a nice swimimng pool which my children liked very much. One can go to downtown London by Tube rail. We used both Heathrow T5 and Hatton Cross tube station. 423 bus is a convenient option for going to Tube station.Few Departmental stores are also there. A very good place to stay near Heathrow.
reviews.title: A nice place near Heathrow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Park Inn is a very well-managed and efficient hotel. Welcoming and helpful staff, Well-equipped and comfortable rooms. Very little aircraft noise.. A good, reasonably priced restaurant and excellent breakfast buffet. Shuttle bus service each half hour, and only ten minutes to Term 1. This will always be our first choice
reviews.title: The Best UK airport hotel we have used

reviews.text: I booked in on one of the parking deals - room and 8 days parking for about £85 and and evening meal. I know its the festive season and obviously big hotels cater for the office party brigade but I really don't want my table to be right in the middle of everyone else's works do - leaving a few tables in a corner for hotel guests would have been appropriate. The food is okay but warm not hot. I didn't have the breakfast as I was leaving the hotel early and must say the Hoppa bus service worked perfectly well at 0600!
reviews.title: Handy location and good parking but that's about it

reviews.text: My biggest gripe relates to the Wifi costs - I've just spent a week in the US where everywhere has free Wifi - shopping malls, convention centres, hotels and airports - so why are being ripped off by the big hotels when it costs no more than about 1p per room per day to operate?
reviews.title: So close to Heathrow

reviews.text: I've stayed at Park Inn several times using their park and flight option and it is a splendid hotel close to Heathrow. Check in was swift and as a Carlson guest I was fortunate to obtain an upgrade to a business class room on the fifth floor which overlooked the airport and was splendid.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: Central location to Heathrow with convenient on site parking. Large welcoming lobby with all staff extremely courteous. The bedroom was clean, well laid out and surprisingly well glazed to ensure no runway noise was evident. Food was expensive and I would suggest a two minute walk from the hotel to the Co-Op food store next door to buy a sandwich. Free newspapers in the foyer. Only downside was guests wheeling luggage along the corridors early morning but not a problem if you are flying at the crack of dawn.
reviews.title: Ideal for Heathrow

reviews.text: Recently stayed at the Park Inn Hotel for a week long conference (Mon - Thur). Overall a very good stay, and I certainly did not hear many planes during my stay (I think I heard about 10 during the whole time)
reviews.title: Not many planes!!!
Some water would have been nice.
reviews.text: Food was excellent, and I had Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner here, and found the food to be of a good high standard. I loved the buffet in the evening (and got ribbed by my workmates for having a poppadum with my Gammon one night!!), with a real wide and varied range of foods available. Breakfast was also very good as well, again with a good range of everything you could want (and eggs being cooked via the kitchen, so not hanging around for ages and going hard)

Bedroom was also very good, I think it was a newly refurbed room, and it was close to reception, so not a long walk. Very clean and everything worked well, and I had 3 nights good sleep (which is rare for me in a hotel)
reviews.title: Great place
Good value and convenient.
reviews.text: Staff were all friendly and efficent. The only downside is the car parking, as its very much a case of find a space and don't move your car...also no Sky Sports so could not watch the champions league matches, however the pub over the road had sky so not an issue

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good hotel if flying from heathrow. Large room. No noise from planes which you can see landing. Food was a let down - pricy and average at best. Wish I had spent 5 mins researching and would then have gone to the pub across the road whose food looked very good compared to what we ate and half the price. Same goes for he alcohol prices. But we did have a good nights sleep. Car park was absolutely chocked and I heard someone say that is always the case. Also £15 per night for guest and £30 for non guest.
reviews.title: Good clean large room, pricy average food

reviews.text: Would we stay agin - yes but would put car in NCP for extra night and go to the pub for our food.
reviews.title: A good option for a place to stay at Heathrow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I should say I was forced to stay here when my flight was delayed, so I have no idea about prices or value for money. It's a huge hotel and I expect there will always be some availability. The arrival was chaotic as two bus-fulls of people all turned up at once; I really think they could have rallied up more than two or three staff to take care of them all. The rooms are perfectly decent. They're similar to those found in the better/newer Travelodges. The one problem I had was that I was freezing. There was no radiator, just a kind of vent that pumped out hot air. It was off when I went in; there were no instructions on how to operate it, but it was easy enough to work out. It took about three hours for the room to become warm, by which time it was almost time for me to get up unfortunately. I made the mistake of turning it off when I went down to breakfast, so when I discovered we were going to be delayed further, I had to start the process all over again. The breakfast is very good. It's self-service and there's loads to choose from, both hot and cold. Staff also go round sorting tea and coffee out for you. I made sure to load up my plate. It was difficult to get the right information from staff at times, but it's difficult to know whether it was them or the airline that was to blame - probably the latter I would say based on my experience. Definitely worth a look if you need a place to stay at Heathrow.
reviews.title: Great airport hotel

reviews.text: As airport hotels go this one is good, nice rooms with all the bits you need , trouser press iron, etc.
reviews.title: no probs

reviews.text: Good decor unlike some airport hotels.
reviews.title: Room cold, noisy, expensive food and drink costs

reviews.text: The aircon on my room was broken and would not come on. Rang the front desk and they sent out a janator to fix it. He took a look at the main control and reported to me that it was broken (which I already knew) - then he left.
reviews.title: Freezing cold

reviews.text: I can see my breath its that cold. Called the front desk again and they offered to send a heater to plug in. After an hour nothing showed up so I called again and they promised to send someone up straight away.....still waiting several hours later so off to bed wearing all the clothes I have.
reviews.title: Good airport hotel, staff vacant!
Good service, poor rooms
reviews.text: They say they are a 4 star hotel - surely that would include a room with some form of heating in December??
This looks dreadful from the outside, but it actually ok.
reviews.title: Poor service but a comfortable room
Very handy for an early flight
reviews.text: The hotel has all you need for an overnight stay at the airport. The lobby makes the hotel look better than it is...! The bar is always busy (24 hour food and drink) and the restaurant is pretty good. They offered a buffet carvery that was excellent value for money with lots of choice.

Booked this hotel for the night before we flew on holiday, and then my wife checked trip advisor and told me the level of bad reviews. So is it that bad? Well the decor is showing it's age, the prices in the bar and restaurant were typical London/Airport. Check-in was prompt and service received was good and polite.
reviews.title: Not brilliant, but does what it says on the tin.

reviews.text: We had booked 15 nights parking. Normally we leave the key to the car, but here you do not - you keep the key and get a ticket to the car-park gate that you have to swap when you return for the most up to date ticket. So bear in mind you have your car key with you throughout your holiday. It is also very busy on the hotel grounds and you may not find a parking place close to the reception - so if you have many bags/children I would drop them off first and then find a space.
reviews.title: Personable staff but hotel needs a lick of paint

reviews.text: The room was clean and comfortable, but the air-con did work, but was not that effective so the room was a little warm. The windows in the room do not open. There is a fridge, but no contents and whilst there was tea/coffee, there are no biscuits, small matter, but something you tend to expect in an hotel. Locally there is a pub and a petrol station shop for those nibbles to keep you going.
reviews.title: Well, you know, it's an airport hotel...

reviews.text: Is it value for money - £138 for one night stay and 15 nights parking, I think so. I do believe that staying over prior to flying is the best option and something we do every year. I would recommend this hotel for such a stay, but probably not for any other type of stay. It is clean and comfortable, but would benefit from an investment to tidy it up.
reviews.title: Convenient for airport

reviews.text: We stayed here as part of a package with Thorpe Park, therefore I feel it was great value for money. However if I were to stay here without the discount I would look elsewhere. The glam photos on the Park inn website do not represent the true picture of the entire hotel facilities. The indoor poor was run down and VERY cold! Bedrooms were tired, looked un clean and could do with a re vamp. On a positive note the staff were lovely, food was great and front of house was modern and bright. The bar prices are extremely pricey but as a treat I swallowed the cost! For convince of location to Heathrow airport I would return for an overnight stay.
reviews.title: Ok for one night and a bargain for parking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A £59 deal for a room the night before our outbound Heathrow flight, plus 8 days car parking, was outstanding value. As a large hotel, with large car park, a long walk from car to reception was not unexpected, but the welcome at reception when we got there was first rate - prompt attention with just the right combination of friendliness, efficiency and communication. Our room seemed to have been recently refurbished, light & airy with all fittings & fixtures clean and in good order, no noise, all leading to a good night's sleep. For convenience, we ate dinner in the hotel dining room, a carvery offering, which was OK in quality, if rather unexciting, and fair value for 3 courses. The dining room decor seemed very dark and depressing though! Didn't have breakfast due to leaving early to fly out. On return after our holiday, went into reception to validate the car park ticket as previously briefed - a job done with no wait despite a busy lobby, as the concierge immediately spotted what we were there for and bore off our ticket for immediate action. So full marks to this place for service, convenience & value as a short-term stopover point.
reviews.title: Great value for pre-flight stopover & parking deal

reviews.text: Having read a few bad reviews about this hotel I was a bit worried but I have to say we absolutley loved the hotel. Yes it is a busy hotel but there is plenty of space, no shortage of food at breakfast and lovely well equipped clean rooms. Not the type of hotel you'd go to for a romantic break but for 1 or 2 nights it was perfect. We booked on the legoland package and the kids got colouring books and crayons on check in which was a nice touch. The conceriege guy was fantastic and gave us some great tips for getting to and from London on the tube. I would defintley stay again and recommend as part of a legoland package
reviews.title: Loved it, booked as part of legoland package

reviews.text: Booked this airport hotel through a discount site so the name wasn't revealed until I had paid. The reason for booking it included 8 days parking as well as a nights accom. The total cost was £57, a bargain.
reviews.title: For the money not as bad as people make out.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ok down to the nitty gritty. The check in was fast and staff I encountered were friendly. The room was small but it was only for the night. In areas there were browns stains (looked like water stains) coming from the ceiling, other than that the room was fairly clean. The pillows were hard but nothing I couldn't handle as it was only for the night.
reviews.title: suprisingly poor for 4 star

reviews.text: The car park for the hotel is massive, so if you do park here lots of space to park the car and without the worry of any damage.
reviews.title: Our new best Airport hotel!

reviews.text: Stayed one night at the end of August.
reviews.title: Awful hotel with rude staff

reviews.text: Truly awful hotel. Let me summarise the bad points >>>
reviews.title: Don't stay on 3rd or 4th floor on a Friday night!

reviews.text: Carpets don’t look like they have been cleaned in years. Room was clean though.
reviews.title: a good nights sleep

reviews.text: Very long wait to check in as flight crews all checking in at the same time. Why they weren’t using their own dedicated area I don’t know.
reviews.title: Very Good Overall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bar prices are extortionate. £4.80 for a Corona.
reviews.title: Wouldn't stay here again even if they paid us

reviews.text: I stayed here once before a few years ago, so I wasn't expecting greatness, but...
reviews.title: Always a bit of a problem...

reviews.text: My company had booked me a Business Room, yet when I checked in, I was given a room with one double bed and one twin, very very basic and not nice at all. I called the front desk to inquire, and they said the air conditioning wasn't working in the Business Room wing. Since the room I was given was so bad, I asked to see the business room anyway. Turns out it was MUCH nicer, newer with better furnishings and a much- much nicer bathroom. So I asked to stay there anyway and had them open the window (it was quite warm in July). There were many other people doing the same thing. Although it didn't have AC I found this a better option than the lousy normal rooms, which are right out of the 1960s and probably haven't seen paint since then. Old carpets, a bit smelly, and VERY basic. It's just not acceptable. And yes, the outside of the hotel has peeling paint and looks bad. This should not be listed as 4-star -- it's not even close. Maybe 2.
reviews.title: Legoland Package - Good value

reviews.text: I thought breakfast was nice. I stayed 4 nights and the buffet breakfast was varied and quite good.
reviews.title: Won't be going back here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Front desk staff were young, junior, not well trained, all seemed very new. They must have very high turnover. Many non-English staff, as mentioned by other posters. I tend to think they don't pay well and get what they can get.
reviews.title: A Good Overnight Stay
Reception needs more training
reviews.text: At checkout, they screwed up my room rate and gave me a ridiculously low rate, but there were so many issues during my stay that I decided to roll with it and not tell them. I think it was 72 pounds sterling per night, and should've been 110. Since they gave me a lower room at checkin and didn't bother to tell me of the AC problem, I didn't feel the slightest bit bad about this.

aka: Park Inn London Heathrow Hotel West Drayton
description: Conveniently situated at London's Heathrow airport- The worlds busiest International airport -and adjacent to London's major motorway networks M4/M25, Park Inn Heathrow is also close to all the excitement of central London, which is just 15 minute train ride away on the Heathrow Express. Park Inn Heathrow is ideally located near Stockley Park Business Centre, Bedfont lakes, Windsor and Maidenhead.
